* Represents a {@code Command} object. It receives command provided by user and handle the valid ones accordingly.

* receive user inputs. (i.e. return {@code False} when command "bye" is inputted)
* If the command is invalid, exception {@code DukeException} will be thrown.
* @return boolean value of whether to continue receiving user command
* @throws DukeException if the command inputted is not valid

System.out.printf("Command \"%s\" requires a date argument. Please try again!\n", "search");

System.out.println("Command \"list\" requires no argument. Please try again!");
System.out.println("Command \"bye\" requires no argument. Please try again!");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");

* Deletes a record from the {@code Record} object based on the given {@code index}. If the record is deleted
* successfully, the program will print message to prompt users that the given task has been deleted.
* Otherwise, the program will print the reason of failure and given task is failed to be deleted.
* @param index index of record, which could be found with {@code list} command, that the user wants to delete

* Mark a record as done based on the given {@code index}.If the record is marked as done successfully, the program
* will print message to prompt users that the given task has been marked as done.
* Otherwise, the program will print the reason of failure and given task is failed to be marked.
* @param index index of record, which could be found with {@code list} command, that the user wants to mark as
System.out.println("Invalid input! (Index cannot be out of bounds)");
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");

* @param date A date in format of yyyy-mm-dd

* Represents a deadline inherited from {@code Task}
* A {@code Deadline} object consists of two parameters:
* 1. {@code taskName}: name of the Deadline object
* 2. {@code dueDay}: date and time [optional] of the due day
* Initializes the Deadline object with the given parameters
* @param taskName name of the Deadline Object
* @param dueDay   deadline of the Deadline Object
* Returns the date of deadline of the Deadline object
* Returns the task type of the Deadline object, i.e. "D"
* @return Task type of the Deadline object
* Returns a string of all information about the Deadline object for displaying in Command-Line Interface
* @return A string of information about the Deadline object for CLI display
* Returns a string of all information about the Deadline object for storage in text file
* @return A string of information about the Deadline object for saving
* Represents an event inherited from {@code Task}
* A {@code Event} object consists of two parameters:
* 1. {@code taskName}: name of the Event object
* 2. {@code schedule}: date and time [optional] of the target day
* Initializes the Event object with the given parameters
* @param taskName name of the Event Object
* @param schedule target day (date and time) of the Event Object
* Returns the date of target day of the Event object
* Returns the task type of the Event object, i.e. "E"

* @return A string of information about the Event object for CLI display
* Returns a string of all information about the Event object for storage in text file

* Returns the date stored in the class
* Returns a string of date and time for displaying in Command-Line Interface
* Returns a string of date and time for storage in text file
